Create a new coordinate system with the following Euler angles: x=-90°, y=0°, z=-90° and the translation vector: (0,0,0). Sketch 1. Draw the first face, *face\_1*, of the part on the XZ plane. 2. Create a loop, *loop\_1*, in *face\_1* with the following sequence of curves: a. Line 1: From (0,0) to (0.1239,0). b. Line 2: From (0.1239,0) to (0.75,0). c. Line 3: From (0.75,0) to (0.75,0.0309). d. Line 4: From (0.75,0.0309) to (0.1239,0.178). e. Line 5: From (0.1239,0.178) to (0.1239,0.0853). f. Line 6: From (0.1239,0.0853) to (0,0.0853). g. Line 7: From (0,0.0853) to (0,0). Ensure each line is connected end-to-end. Extrusion 1. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 2. Extrude the sketch along its normal by a depth of 0.0115. 3. Perform a NewBodyFeatureOperation to add the object as a new solid body. Part 2: A Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom, and a Curved Side Follow the instructions below to construct the second part of the CAD model: Coordinate System 1. Create a new coordinate system by translating the previous one by (0.0115,0.0319,0.0116) in the global coordinates. Sketch 1. Draw *face\_1* of the part on the XY plane. 2. Create *loop\_1* in *face\_1* with the following sequence: a. Circle\_1: Center (0.0288,0.0288), Radius: 0.0288 Extrusion 1. Set the sketch scaling to 0.0577. 2. Perform a CutFeatureOperation to remove material and create a cylindrical indent. 3. Set the extrusion depths towards normal and opposite normal to 0. These instructions should help the junior CAD designer build the CAD model accurately without making any assumptions.</description>
